extracted-table.table-caption: Overview about the cohort studies included in the OPTIMAL project. The table shows the number of patients enrolled, the respective inclusion criteria and the type of dementia diagnosis given in each study.
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: SVD = small vessel disease, WMH = white matter hyperintensities, MCI = mild cognitive impairment.

caption.p: Overview about the cohort studies included in the OPTIMAL project. The table shows the number of patients enrolled, the respective inclusion criteria and the type of dementia diagnosis given in each study.

tr.td: 3 years imaging measures5 years clinical measures

Symptomatic SVD, defined as a clinical lacunar stroke syndrome with MRI evidence of an anatomically corresponding lacunar infarct, and with confluent regions of WMH graded ≥ 2 on the modified Fazekas scale (Fazekas et al., 1987)
Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders V
RUN DMC (van Norden et al., 2011)(Mild SVD)
SVD, defined as the presence of lacunes and or WMH on neuroimaging and accompanying acute (lacunar) or subacute (cognitive, motor) symptoms
Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders IV
National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke–Association Internationale pour la Recherché et l’Enseignement en Neurosciencescriteria (Erkinjuntti, 1994)
National Institute on Aging and Alzheimer's Association criteria (McKhann et al., 2011)

Symptomatic SVD, defined as a clinical lacunar stroke syndrome with MRI evidence of an anatomically corresponding lacunar infarct, and with confluent regions of WMH graded ≥ 2 on the modified Fazekas scale (Fazekas et al., 1987)
Subgroup of patients with mild cognitive impairment (MCI) impaired in at least one cognitive domain of a formal neuropsychological test battery, with or without a history of stroke
Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders IV
National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke–Association Internationale pour la Recherché et l’Enseignement en Neurosciencescriteria (Erkinjuntti, 1994)
National Institute on Aging and Alzheimer's Association criteria (McKhann et al., 2011)
Being free of dementia and stroke as well as demonstrating normal neurological function
Diagnosis of CADASIL confirmed by genetic testing or skin biopsy

fn.p: SVD = small vessel disease, WMH = white matter hyperintensities, MCI = mild cognitive impairment.

extracted-table.table-caption: Cross-sectional analysis between DTI and Global Cognition while accounting for clinical markers. All imaging markers were associated with impaired cognitive function in the severe SVD (SCANS), mild SVD (RUN DMC) and MCI cohort (HARMONISATION).
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: MD Median = mean diffusivity median of the WM histogram, PC1 = scores of the first principal component, PSMD = peak width of skeletonized mean diffusivity, DSEG θ = diffusion tensor image segmentation θ, Geff = global efficiency network measure, β = standardized regression coefficient, 95 % CI = 95 % confidence interval, AIC = Akaike information criterion, P-Value = statistical value of significance with p < 0.05.

caption.p: Cross-sectional analysis between DTI and Global Cognition while accounting for clinical markers. All imaging markers were associated with impaired cognitive function in the severe SVD (SCANS), mild SVD (RUN DMC) and MCI cohort (HARMONISATION).

fn.p: MD Median = mean diffusivity median of the WM histogram, PC1 = scores of the first principal component, PSMD = peak width of skeletonized mean diffusivity, DSEG θ = diffusion tensor image segmentation θ, Geff = global efficiency network measure, β = standardized regression coefficient, 95 % CI = 95 % confidence interval, AIC = Akaike information criterion, P-Value = statistical value of significance with p < 0.05.

extracted-table.table-caption: Cross-sectional analysis between DTI and Global Cognition or TMT-B while accounting for the clinical markers. In severe SVD and monogenic SVD all imaging markers were associated with impaired cognitive function. Only MD median, DSEG θ and Geff were significantly related to impaired cognitive function in the community cohort with normal neurological functioning.
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: MD Median = mean diffusivity median of the WM histogram, PC1 = scores of the first principal component, PSMD = peak width of skeletonized mean diffusivity, DSEG θ = diffusion tensor image segmentation θ, Geff = global efficiency network measure, β = standardized regression coefficient, 95 % CI = 95 % confidence interval, AIC = Akaike information criterion, P-Value = statistical value of significance with p < 0.05.

caption.p: Cross-sectional analysis between DTI and Global Cognition or TMT-B while accounting for the clinical markers. In severe SVD and monogenic SVD all imaging markers were associated with impaired cognitive function. Only MD median, DSEG θ and Geff were significantly related to impaired cognitive function in the community cohort with normal neurological functioning.

extracted-table.table-caption: Baseline DTI measures predicting dementia conversion while accounting for the clinical markers. Baseline PSMD and PC1 measures predicted dementia conversion in SCANS, RUN DMC and HARMONISATION. In RUN DMC MD median and DSEG was not associated with dementia. In HARMONISATION baseline Geff did not predict dementia conversion.
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: MD Median = mean diffusivity median of the WM histogram, PC1 = scores of the first principal component, PSMD = peak width of skeletonized mean diffusivity, DSEG θ = diffusion tensor image segmentation θ, Geff = global efficiency network measure, AIC = Akaike information criterion, HR = hazard ratio, AUC = area under the curve, AIC = Akaike information criterion, 95 % CI = 95 % confidence interval, P-Value = statistical value of significance with p < 0.05.

caption.p: Baseline DTI measures predicting dementia conversion while accounting for the clinical markers. Baseline PSMD and PC1 measures predicted dementia conversion in SCANS, RUN DMC and HARMONISATION. In RUN DMC MD median and DSEG was not associated with dementia. In HARMONISATION baseline Geff did not predict dementia conversion.

fn.p: MD Median = mean diffusivity median of the WM histogram, PC1 = scores of the first principal component, PSMD = peak width of skeletonized mean diffusivity, DSEG θ = diffusion tensor image segmentation θ, Geff = global efficiency network measure, AIC = Akaike information criterion, HR = hazard ratio, AUC = area under the curve, AIC = Akaike information criterion, 95 % CI = 95 % confidence interval, P-Value = statistical value of significance with p < 0.05.

extracted-table.table-caption: Change in DTI measures in each cohort studies. There were significant changes in all measures in all cohorts except for PRESERVE and CADASIL. In PRESERVE there was a significant change DSEG and MD Median but not for PSMD and Geff. In CADASIL there was only a marginally significant change for Geff.
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: MD Median = mean diffusivity median of the WM histogram, PC1 = scores of the first principal component, PSMD = peak width of skeletonized mean diffusivity, DSEG θ = diffusion tensor image segmentation θ, Geff = global efficiency network measure.P-Value = statistical value of significance with p < 0.05.

caption.p: Change in DTI measures in each cohort studies. There were significant changes in all measures in all cohorts except for PRESERVE and CADASIL. In PRESERVE there was a significant change DSEG and MD Median but not for PSMD and Geff. In CADASIL there was only a marginally significant change for Geff.

fn.p: MD Median = mean diffusivity median of the WM histogram, PC1 = scores of the first principal component, PSMD = peak width of skeletonized mean diffusivity, DSEG θ = diffusion tensor image segmentation θ, Geff = global efficiency network measure.
P-Value = statistical value of significance with p < 0.05.

fn.label: a
fn.p: linear mixed model in SCANS with the output: baseline intercept (95% confidence interval), estimated annual mean change (95% confidence interval) and p-value for each single imaging measure.

fn.label: b
fn.p: paired t-test in RUN DMC, HARMONISATION, PRESERVE and CADASIL with the output: baseline mean (standard deviation), absolute mean change (standard deviation) between 2 time points and p-value for each single imaging measure.

extracted-table.table-caption: Change in DTI measures associated with dementia conversion while accounting for the clinical markers. Change in DTI was consistently associated with dementia conversion only in severe SVD but not in mild SVD or MCI. The AUC was highest and AIC lowest for DSEG. Change in MD Median was associated with dementia conversion in HARMONISATION.
extracted-table.table-wrap-foot: MD Median = Mean diffusivity Median of the aWM histogram, PC1 = Scores of the first principal component, PSMD = Peak width of skeletonized mean diffusivity, DSEG θ = Diffusion tensor image segmentation θ, Geff = Global efficiency network measure, AIC = Akaike information criterion, HR = hazard ratio, OR = Odd’s ratio, AUC = area under the cruve, AIC = Akaike information criterion, 95 % CI = 95 % confidence interval, P-Value = statistical value of significance with p < 0.05.

caption.p: Change in DTI measures associated with dementia conversion while accounting for the clinical markers. Change in DTI was consistently associated with dementia conversion only in severe SVD but not in mild SVD or MCI. The AUC was highest and AIC lowest for DSEG. Change in MD Median was associated with dementia conversion in HARMONISATION.

fn.p: MD Median = Mean diffusivity Median of the aWM histogram, PC1 = Scores of the first principal component, PSMD = Peak width of skeletonized mean diffusivity, DSEG θ = Diffusion tensor image segmentation θ, Geff = Global efficiency network measure, AIC = Akaike information criterion, HR = hazard ratio, OR = Odd’s ratio, AUC = area under the cruve, AIC = Akaike information criterion, 95 % CI = 95 % confidence interval, P-Value = statistical value of significance with p < 0.05.
